parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Authentication token for the request. The service supports AAD user/app authentication. For AAD, the header value must be in the format: Bearer {token}.

parameters.name: MS-CV
parameters.description: Correlation Vector for the request. If not provided, then the service generates a new one.

requestBody.description: An asset group with the following fields provided: qualifier, deleteAgentId, ownerId. It is not required to set both deleteAgentId and ownerId, but you must have at least one of them.

200.description: The created asset group with service generated properties filled in (such as Id and ETag).

get.summary: Reads all asset groups using the provided query options.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Authentication token for the request. The service supports AAD user/app authentication. For AAD, the header value must be in the format: Bearer {token}.

parameters.name: MS-CV
parameters.description: Correlation Vector for the request. If not provided, then the service generates a new one.

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: A select clause for the query. If provided, then only the requested properties are returned. If not provided, then all properties are returned.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: A filter clause for the query. Filters are supported for the ownerId and deleteAgentId properties. Ex: $filter=ownerId eq '{id}'.

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: Determines page size for the request. If not provided, then server side paging will be used.

parameters.name: $skip
parameters.description: Determines page index for the request. If not provided, then the first page is returned.

200.description: A collection of asset groups. If server-side paging is triggered, than the nextLink property will be set. Use that to download the next page.

put.summary: Updates an asset group. This uses replace semantics, so all fields must be provided even if they are unchanged.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Authentication token for the request. The service supports AAD user/app authentication. For AAD, the header value must be in the format: Bearer {token}.

parameters.name: MS-CV
parameters.description: Correlation Vector for the request. If not provided, then the service generates a new one.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the asset group to update.

requestBody.description: An asset group with all fields provided (tracking details can be excluded).

200.description: The updated asset group.

delete.summary: Deletes an asset group by id.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Authentication token for the request. The service supports AAD user/app authentication. For AAD, the header value must be in the format: Bearer {token}.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: The ETag of the previously downloaded asset group. A non matching value will result in a failure.

parameters.name: MS-CV
parameters.description: Correlation Vector for the request. If not provided, then the service generates a new one.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the asset group to delete.

get.summary: Reads an asset group by id.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Authentication token for the request. The service supports AAD user/app authentication. For AAD, the header value must be in the format: Bearer {token}.

parameters.name: MS-CV
parameters.description: Correlation Vector for the request. If not provided, then the service generates a new one.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the asset group to retrieve.

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: A select clause for the query. If provided, then only the requested properties are returned. If not provided, then all properties are returned.

200.description: The asset group if found.

get.summary:
API always returns isCompliant = true state
            Changes to this API are being made as part of Decoupling from cosmos 
            After discussion from Scott, we can return IsCompliant = true and deprecate the AssetGroupWorker

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Authentication token for the request. The service supports AAD user/app authentication. For AAD, the header value must be in the format: Bearer {token}.

parameters.name: MS-CV
parameters.description: Correlation Vector for the request. If not provided, then the service generates a new one.

parameters.name: qualifier
parameters.description: The fully specified asset qualifier to search on. Use the identity library to create valid qualifiers.

200.description: The ComplianceState is always compliant.

post.summary: Link/unlink asset groups to agents or create/delete requests for linking (based on ownership).

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Authentication token for the request. The service supports AAD user/app authentication. For AAD, the header value must be in the format: Bearer {token}.

parameters.name: MS-CV
parameters.description: Correlation Vector for the request. If not provided, then the service generates a new one.

requestBody.description: The set of relationships and actions to apply.

200.description: The results of each releationship action.

post.summary: Remove/unlink variants from the given asset group.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Authentication token for the request. The service supports AAD user/app authentication. For AAD, the header value must be in the format: Bearer {token}.

parameters.name: MS-CV
parameters.description: Correlation Vector for the request. If not provided, then the service generates a new one.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the asset group.

requestBody.description: Action parameter that contains a list of variant ids that should be removed from the asset group.

200.description: The updated asset group with the variants removed.

get.summary: Calculates the registration status for an AssetGroup.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Authentication token for the request. The service supports AAD user/app authentication. For AAD, the header value must be in the format: Bearer {token}.

parameters.name: MS-CV
parameters.description: Correlation Vector for the request. If not provided, then the service generates a new one.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the asset group to retrieve.

200.description: The asset group registration status.

post.summary: Creates a data agent. Agent must of of type v2.DeleteAgent

requestBody.description: A data agent with the following fields provided: qualifier, deleteAgentId, ownerId. It is not required to set both deleteAgentId and ownerId, but you must have at least one of them.

200.description: The created data agent with service generated properties filled in (such as Id and ETag).

get.summary: Reads all data agents using the provided query options.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Authentication token for the request. The service supports AAD user/app authentication. For AAD, the header value must be in the format: Bearer {token}.

parameters.name: MS-CV
parameters.description: Correlation Vector for the request. If not provided, then the service generates a new one.

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: A select clause for the query. If provided, then only the requested properties are returned. If not provided, then all properties are returned.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: A filter clause for the query. Filters are supported for the ownerId and name properties. Ex: $filter=ownerId eq '{id}'.

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: Determines page size for the request. If not provided, then server side paging will be used.

parameters.name: $skip
parameters.description: Determines page index for the request. If not provided, then the first page is returned.

200.description: A collection of data agents. If server-side paging is triggered, than the nextLink property will be set. Use that to download the next page.

put.summary: Updates a data agent. This uses replace semantics, so all fields must be provided even if they are unchanged.

parameters.description: The id of the data agent to update.

requestBody.description: A data agent with all fields provided (tracking details can be excluded).

200.description: The updated data agent.

get.summary:
Reads all data owners for the current authenticated user. It identifies the security groups for the user
            and then retrieves any data owner that contains any of the user's security groups.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Authentication token for the request. The service supports AAD user/app authentication. For AAD, the header value must be in the format: Bearer {token}.

parameters.name: MS-CV
parameters.description: Correlation Vector for the request. If not provided, then the service generates a new one.

200.description: A collection of data owners. Paging is not supported for this API, so all owners are returned.

post.summary:
Finds the existing data owner that contains the given serviceTree.serviceId
            and replaces the serviceTree object for the provided data owner with the found values.
            It then deletes the original service tree data owner and returns the updated owner.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Authentication token for the request. The service supports AAD user/app authentication. For AAD, the header value must be in the format: Bearer {token}.

parameters.name: MS-CV
parameters.description: Correlation Vector for the request. If not provided, then the service generates a new one.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the data owner to update.

requestBody.description:
Action parameters that contain a data owner with all fields provided
            (tracking details can be excluded). The serviceTree.serviceId must be set to the id that should be replaced.

200.description: The updated data owner with properties replaced by the existing service tree entity.

parameters.description: Authentication token for the request. The service supports AAD user/app authentication. For AAD, the header value must be in the format: Bearer {token}.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: The ETag of the previously downloaded Variant request. A non matching value will result in a failure.

parameters.name: MS-CV
parameters.description: Correlation Vector for the request. If not provided, then the service generates a new one.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the Variant request to approve.

delete.summary: Deletes a variant request by id.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Authentication token for the request. The service supports AAD user/app authentication. For AAD, the header value must be in the format: Bearer {token}.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: The ETag of the previously downloaded Variant request. A non matching value will result in a failure.

parameters.name: MS-CV
parameters.description: Correlation Vector for the request. If not provided, then the service generates a new one.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the Variant request to delete.

get.summary: Reads a variant request by id.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Authentication token for the request. The service supports AAD user/app authentication, the header value must be in the format: Bearer {token}.

parameters.name: MS-CV
parameters.description: Correlation Vector for the request. If not provided, then the service generates a new one.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the Variant request to retrieve.

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: A select clause for the query. If provided, then only the requested properties are returned. If not provided, then all properties are returned.

200.description: The Variant request if found.

get.summary: Reads all variant requests using the provided query options.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Authentication token for the request. The service supports AAD user/app authentication. For AAD, the header value must be in the format: Bearer {token}.

parameters.name: MS-CV
parameters.description: Correlation Vector for the request. If not provided, then the service generates a new one.

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: A select clause for the query. If provided, then only the requested properties are returned. If not provided, then all properties are returned.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: A filter clause for the query. Filters are supported for the ownerId and deleteAgentId properties. Ex: $filter=ownerId eq '{id}'.

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: Determines page size for the request. If not provided, then server side paging will be used.

parameters.name: $skip
parameters.description: Determines page index for the request. If not provided, then the first page is returned.

200.description: A collection of Variant requests. If server-side paging is triggered, than the nextLink property will be set. Use that to download the next page.
